alert.note: Alert for Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Waldo; Interior York; Knox; Lincoln (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 5:11AM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations up to 6 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine and central and northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The wet nature of the snow will cause weighted tree limbs of conifers and may cause snapped branches especially when combined with strong winds. Snow will change over to rain, with a period of sleet and/or freezing rain at transition which will cause slushy roads and further degrade driving conditions. Plan on delaying travel to allow time for road conditions to improve. The hazardous conditions will impact the Wednesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
